title: Stunning Rogers double secures Villa win over Man Utd
description: Morgan Rogers scores twice for Aston Villa in their 2-1 win against Manchester United, extending Villa's unbeaten run to 10 matches in all competitions.

title: Chelsea hammer nine goals past Liverpool in Women's League Cup
description: Chelsea put nine past Liverpool in the Women's League Cup to progress to the semi-finals, as Sam Kerr scores the opening two goals and Johanna Rytting Kaneryd completes a hat-trick.

title: The best team today lost - Amorim
description: Manchester United Manager Ruben Amorim says that Manchester United performed better despite losing 2-1 to Aston Villa.

title: Emery elated with 'fantastic' Aston Villa win
description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery praises his "fantastic" players in a hard-fought 2-1 win against Manchester United.

title: England unable to hold out as Australia retain the Ashes
description: Australia beat England by 82 runs to take a 3-0 series lead and retain the Ashes urn on day five of the third Test in Adelaide.

title: 'Unbelievable!' - Bears' dramatic late touchdown stuns Packers
description: Chicago Bears move to the brink of the play-offs with a dramatic 22-16 overtime win at home to the Green Bay Packers.

title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
description: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
description: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: Guz Khan's modern-day Christmas story for the whole family
description: The Farooqi family have a chaotic Christmas in Lapland after a surprise bonus for Dad.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
description: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
description: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
description: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.

title: What next for friendly foes who see each other 'more than family'?
description: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz have dominated men‚Äôs tennis in 2025. BBC Sport looks at the evolution of their growing rivalry ‚Äì and where it could go next.
